description: The presenter describes her dad as a "generous man" who instilled a "lifelong love of sport" in her.

title: Can you name every FA Cup winner?
description: The FA Cup third round takes place this weekend - we want you to name every winner of the competition since it began in 1872.

title: How will Chelsea play under new boss Rosenior?
description: What is Liam Rosenior's style of play and how might his Chelsea side shape up tactically?

title: Arsenal extend lead at top of table after draw with Liverpool
description: Arsenal miss the chance to move eight points clear at the top of the Premier League after they are held to a frustrating goalless draw by Liverpool.

title: England show fight but fall short as Australia seal 4-1 Ashes win
description: After bowling England out for 342, Australia chase down their winning target of 160 with five wickets in hand to win the fifth Ashes Test on the final day in Sydney, sealing a 4-1 series win to retain the urn.

title: Slot pleased with 'disciplined' Liverpool performance
description: Liverpool boss Arne Slot is full of praise for how "disciplined" his side were as they held Premier League leaders Arsenal to a 0-0 draw at Emirates Stadium.

title: 'We need to be smarter' - Stokes admits England must improve
description: Ben Stokes says it's time for "some honest truths" to be shared amongst his team, following England's 4-1 Ashes series defeat in Australia.

title: Arsenal too 'unprecise' with final ball - Arteta
description: Arsenal boss Mikel Arteta feels his side were too "unprecise" with their final ball as they were held to a 0-0 draw by Liverpool at Emirates Stadium.

title: 'The culture needs to change' - Vaughan on Brook nightclub altercation
description: Michael Vaughan gives his thoughts on England's white-ball captain, Harry Brook, after he apologised for being involved in an altercation with a nightclub bouncer the night before a one-day international on the tour of New Zealand that preceded the Ashes.

title: Archive: Yorath recalls tragedies and their impact
description: In 2013, the late Terry Yorath spoke to BBC Wales Sport before the League Cup final between Swansea City and Bradford City, teams he had managed.

title: Carey hits four to seal five-wicket win for Australia
description: Alex Carey secures victory in style for Australia, as he hits a four to seal a five-wicket win against England on day five of the fifth Ashes Test in Sydney, as Australia win the series 4-1.

title: Sutton's FA Cup third-round predictions v DJ and producer Shadow Child
description: BBC Sport football expert Chris Sutton takes on DJ and producer Shadow Child - and AI - with his predictions for all 32 FA Cup third-round ties.

title: Brook, 'Boozeball' and another Ashes hangover
description: The revelation Harry Brook got into a fight with a bouncer brings further focus on the culture of the England team.

title: Unloved in PE, ignored at top - what is cross country's future?
description: Cross country evokes miserable school memories for many, while top athletes focus on Olympic disciplines instead - what is its future?

title: 'Whoever signed off England's tour has to go' - Agnew column
description: England's 4-1 Ashes defeat is the most disappointing I have covered and whoever signed off on the tourists' preparation has to go, writes Jonathan Agnew.

title: Tactics, transfers and turmoil - inside the fall of Amorim
description: After 14 months, Ruben Amorim has been sacked by Manchester United - but where did it all go wrong?

title: Jennifer Lawrence stars in this high-stakes dystopian film
description: The 12 districts of Panem must offer up two tributes to fight in the annual Hunger Games

title: Booze, beach, beaten - how England lost the Ashes
description: BBC Sport chief cricket reporter Stephan Shemilt reveals the inside story of England's Ashes defeat in Australia on and off the pitch.

title: I've realised I can make a difference - Hoy
description: In a new BBC documentary, Sir Chris Hoy shows how he is using his Olympic mindset to reframe his purpose following a terminal cancer diagnosis.

title: The man behind the headlines - Salah, by Klopp, Diaz and more
description: BBC Sport explores Mohamed Salah's personality with help from the people who know him best.

title: Inside McLaren's season - the rules, values, incidents & relationships
description: Intra-team title battles turn toxic far more often than not. Andrew Benson analyses how McLaren have maintained relative harmony between Lando Norris and Oscar Piastri.

title: England's AI World Cup masterplan - from perfecting penalties to powering players
description: BBC Sport hears from inside the England setup about how artificial intelligence is powering plans for next summer's World Cup.

title: Watch trailer for Robbie Savage: Managing Macclesfield FC
description: Watch the trailer for new BBC documentary Robbie Savage: Managing Macclesfield FC.

title: 'Raise hell' - the fastest bowler you might not have heard of
description: The story of Duncan Spencer, the "frighteningly fast" bowler who could have played for England or Australia.
